inn1.comm: full outside off, hint of swing away from Cook, left alone
very similar, hanging it outside off, through to the keeper
touch fuller this time, brings Cook onto the front foot and he drives into the covers but there's a good stop to keep him on nought
on leg stump, neatly clipped off the pads through square leg to get England up and running
full and wider outside off, Cook isn't interested
tighter to the stumps but he lets another one to go through to end the opening over
full on off, hint of shape away, defended to the covers
full on middle, Bell steps across the crease and defends towards midwicket
solidly behind the line, just a firm push through the line of a full delivery on off stump which beats mid-off who is quite wide
this time it's played a touch wider so straight to mid-off
doesn't get forward this time, defended to short cover
back of a length, Bell opens the face and pushes a single into the covers
a solid drive from Bell, onto the front foot, but straight to mid-off
shorter length, Bell opens the face off the back foot and places it through point

first signs of aggressive, Bell picks up a length delivery outside off stump and lofts it over midwicket. The bat turned a bit on his hands and it was more a thick inside part of the bat, then it plugged in the outfield
left alone outside off
on the back foot, opens the face and guides down to third man
full on leg stump, Cook nearly falls across the line as he plays to mid-on
full on off stump, getting some shape away, driven to cover
a bouncer, first one of the day, Bell goes for the pull but is through his shot early and it goes over the top edge then is called a wide
short of a length, nicely whipped through straight midwicket for another brace...played at the top of the bounce
well timed from Bell as Malinga goes fuller and he leans into a drive which goes to the left of mid-off and despite a slowish outfield reaches the rope
another short ball, middle and leg line, Bell rolls his wrists as he pulls to long leg...very little pace in this pitch
touch of swing into the pads, clipped to short midwicket
low full toss outside off but Cook misses out as he drives to cover...should have been a boundary
short outside off, goes for the cut but misses out as he gets a bottom edge into the ground
short of a length, defended to backward point
sweetly struck from Bell, coming froward into a cover drive, but it's rifled straight to short cover
picks out the cover field with another drive, but this time it isn't stopped cleanly so he gets a single
gets this one away off his toes through midwicket, Mathews chases hard from mid-on and flicks it back with a dive near the boundary

beaten...and an appeal for a stumping. Nice delivery, nipped away to beat the outside edge then Sangakkara whips off the bails as he thinks he sees Bell's back foot lift for a fraction of a second but Michael Gough says not out without use of TV. The foot did lift for a split second, but Sanga's timing was just off
a little short and wide to start with, nicely cut behind point by Cook who waited to play the ball late
adjusts to full on middle, defended to midwicket
comes forward and defends

another cut from Cook, more of a thick edge this time and it runs finer...Kulasekara chases, kicks it back with his boot then almost does himself some mischief by running through the advertising boards. Malinga just giggles.
comes forward, opens the face and plays to cover
hint of turn into Bell who pushes back down the pitch
full on off stump, Cook is square up a little as he defends to mid-off
onto off stump and defends to cover
whipped off middle stump to midwicket
delicate this time, holds his shot a little longer then opens the face to run it down to third man
goes in the air down the ground, gets enough power to clear mid-on but the timing wasn't quite there...again it plugs in the soft outfield. Intent from Bell.
tries to run this to third man but can't beat backward point
stretches forward, a little uncertainly, and defends
think he's trying to read him off the pitch, opens the face but can't get a single
this one is flicked out, straighter delivery, defended off the back foot
beats the top edge as Cook tries to cut
one that drifts into the left hander, pushed square into the off side
full outside off, this time he pierces the off side field with a gentle drive but it's placed wide enough of long-off for a second
full at leg stump, Bell misses as he goes to flick it away
shapes back into Bell from back of a length and defended to cover

dropped, a pretty simple chance from Jayawardene at midwicket. A slower ball, Bell was through his shot and flicked it at head height. Mahela had to jump a little, but timed it right yet still couldn't hold on
full, driven to mid-off
offered some width this time and doesn't miss out, a strong cut which races through backward point...third man had no chance.
dismissive! That's a cracker from Bell. Full outside off and Bell plays a powerful cover drive on the up which bisects the off-side field
neat placement, opens the face at the last minute to drive it between point and cover
pushed to point
dabbed fine, backward points manages to get around
full at the stumps, pushed down to long-on
forward and pushed into the off side
this one spins back into Cook, cramps him for room, not picked, but he manages to jab down on it
full at Bell's feet, flicked down to long-on
poor delivery, pushed down the leg side, good take from Sangakkara
back outside off, driven to point
low full toss, flicked away through midwicket...bit of a freebie from Mendis
on leg stump again, glanced away fine...wayward start from Mendis
driven to the right of mid-off
close! This one confounds Bell, extra bounce and it beats him then carries just over off stump
touch short outside off, cut through point to the cover sweeper
goes for the reverse sweep, misses and gets taken on the pad
uses his feet but then pushes the ball back to the bowler
some slow turn, Bell eases this down the ground with a straight bat
full on off stump, defended
held back, a touch slower, Cook places it out to the cover sweeper
fired down the leg side again, Sangakkara can't take this so they scamper an extra run as well although Sangakkara hits the stumps direct
pushed down to long-on
full on off stump, driven to cover who dives over the ball
uses his feet, it's a short delivery from Mendis, Bell then flicks it through midwicket with good placement between two men in the deep
short outside off, driven to cover where, this time, Mathews gets a hand on it with a dive and although he parries the ball away it was enough to put the batsmen off the single
drives and gets beaten
forward and defends, Mendis skips across to field it himself
fraction short, Bell hangs back, waits for the turn then flicks into square leg
lunges forward and pushes to cover
tries to guide this fine with a late cut but picks out short third man
tries the same shot with the same end result
quicker delivery, mixing it up nicely, Cook flicks to midwicket for another dot
a scampered single to point, was safe enough in the end but a sign of pressure building after a tight cover
gets this one through the in-field, Mendis continues to leak runs, Cook uses a strong bottom hand to flick this through midwicket off the back foot
fired in full, dug out towards mid-off but he's on the edge of the circle and can't stop the single
gets away with a miscue into the leg side, using his feet and aiming to go over midwicket but fluffs the shot just wide of the man inside the circle

gets away with another! A long hop from Mendis, what a way to go that would have been, it barely reached Bell as he goes to pull, loses his shape and it comes off the toe of the bat but falls short of deep square leg
this one grips a bit, beats the edge, takes Cook on the back leg

gone this time! What a mixture from Mendis (and Bell). The batsman can barely believe it. Pops a dolly of a return catch to Mendis as the ball, just short of a length, stopped in the pitch which meant Bell played too early.
Cook misses trying to cut outside off
forward and drops this into the covers for a quick single
full length just outside off stump punched down to long-off
forward just blocking a length ball angled into off stump
fuller and driven without timing to long-off, easy run
driven at, slightly on the up but it falls short of short extra
full on leg stump, clipped down to long-on
full again more off stump this time, pushed out to deep cover
not as much air, easy to tap this out to deep cover again
shorter length and deep cover is this time found off the back foot
very full this time, Cook digs it out to short midwicket
driveable length once more, easy push to deep cover
tries to drive off side and gets a thick inside edge into his pad that nearly finds it way back onto the stumps
straight line, pushed back to the bowler
off stump and tapped to extra-cover on the front foot
more air and driven out to deep cover this time
Cook hangs back and for the first time in several attempts evades short third man with a late cut, it runs towards the boundary and they get a couple
now the full-bloodied cut but finds backward point, just struggled to negotiate the gaps in that area has Cook
very full and driven back to the bowler
tries to open the face on this drive but it's well saved by short extra
now finds the gap and drives to long-off
too short and Cook able to cut, and gets it past the fielder!! Just one though as deep cover runs to his right
full and a firm drive down to long-off
down the wicket, right to the pitch, Cook was aiming wide of long-off but could only find the fielder for a single once more
full and clipped to mid-on whom they take on for a single and get home easily
touch of width and driven with an open face to deep cover
down the wicket but almost yorks himself, ends up digging it out down to long-off
firm drive but finds extra cover
off stump and swept, get it square of deep midwicket so they pick up a couple
wider line outside off, driven past cover but only a single to the man in the deep

and he strikes first ball! Length outside off stump, Ballance went to play it into the covers but, like Bell's dismissal, it totally stopped in the wicket and Ballance popped a catch back to the bowler. Another bonus for Sri Lanka, a pretty ordinary delivery getting stuck in the wicket
full on the stumps, clipped down to long-on for an easy single
short and pulled down and out to deep square leg, hundred up
full at the stumps, clipped to short midwicket
length outside off, waited for and clipped down to third man
short and pulled again out to deep square
length just outside off, played from the crease and knocked back to the bowler
drops the length back slightly and it's a straight line too, Cook whips it out to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, dropped down on the leg side but they refuse the run they briefly considered
touch wider line, Root opens the face and drops this down to third man
straight just back of a length again and this is whipped to the leg side again but Cook and this brings up his half-century in 69 balls
short outside off, Root thought about playing but left and it was then called wide
played from the crease to point, no single available
full on the leg stump but Cook manages to force it away past midwicket and they get a couple
bumper, Cook right on top of it and hook down to long leg
full toss on leg stump and Root gets a tickle on it that runs fine of long leg
another full toss, on off stump, driven to extra cover
full on leg stump, clipped down to long leg
slower ball on off stump, rolled to extra cover
around the wicket, short enough to pull and they get two wide of deep square leg

full, Root goes to reverse sweep and misses, there's two cries, one for lbw and then, when the ball popped up to Sangakkara, for a catch behind. Not out given on both counts but they go for the review and it looks straight off the glove. Yep smack bang off the glove, straight up and Sangakkara takes the catch walking a yard in front of the stumps
around the wicket to Morgan too, played forward and gets it off the pad up on the leg side
this slides down leg, wide ball
more off stump and blocked on the front foot
forward on dabbed into the leg side
back to cut and misses outside off
similar delivery, this time finds the willow and gets it out to deep cover
forward just outside off dropping this down to third man
fullish length but Cook hangs back to try and force it square but finds point
back foot clip but finds backward point again, a lot of balls Cook has eaten up today so far
looks to work leg side and gets a little inside edge but it lands short of the keeper, a little cutter from the bowler
full on leg stump, tucked into the leg side for an easy run into square leg
forward and driven to extra cover
pushed into the same region again
fuller and a flourishing drive out to deep cover
back and tapped out easily to deep cover again
waited for and tries to back-cut but finds short third man, seen that before today
a step down the wicket and tries to go leg side but only finds short midwicket
just a careful little block in the crease
flicked aerially leg side but safely away from midwicket, that stopped in the wicket again
paddle swept from outside off, it was outside the line
short enough to cut hard and finds deep point
a shuffle to find the deep fielder on the off side again
full just outside off, a little paddle sweep to tuck fine on the leg side and they get a couple
a reach outside off and heaved over long-on, big slog sweep, no-one out there anyway but that was nailed
forward on the stumps and played up the wicket
full length and driven back to the bowler
tries to come down, then stopped and just blocked
tried to paddle sweep but the bowler sent it wider of off stump, Morgan tried to adjust but got struck on the pad and it ran fine of short third man for a quick leg bye
stays in the crease and tries to force square, can't beat backward point
full on leg stump, pushed back to the bowler
shorter length but Morgan can't get onto it and just taps it back to the bowler
fuller length and ran back to the bowler again
pushed in the air, it stuck in the wicket again, wide of short extra though and down to long-off for a single
quicker ball, played from middle and off to short midwicket
back and pushed out to deep cover

goes to paddle sweep but like Root it's popped a catch up to Sangakkara and that completes a real grind from Cook since passing fifty, slowed right down. Trying to tuck it around the corner, it took a decent top edge and looped up behind the keeper who spun 180 degrees, took two steps forward and claimed the easy catch

played forward just outside off, it beats the outside edge and then Sangakkara whips off the bails and wails an appeal for a stumping, the umpire has gone upstairs to check it, Bopara did drag his back foot forward, is he just behind the line? It's very close but Bopara has a smidgen of boot in safe ground but that was living dangerously
back and tucks a straight delivery through square leg
Morgan down to paddle sweep, safer off a short length, tucked easily around the corner for a couple
so Morgan steps to leg and tries to play off side but only finds the bowler

length angled into off stump, Bopara trying to play to leg on the crease misses and gets struck high on the pad, a massive cry from the bowler for lbw, not out given but Mathews is very keen and goes for the review only to find the ball on Hawk Eye going comfortable over the stumps, poor review
from the crease, opens the face and gets it fine of third man, they sprint hard an come back for the second
driven firmly to mid-off and Bopara is off again here and oh dear, a direct hit at the bowler's end had him gone but the fielder missed

blocked just backward of point but not backward enough for a single, there's a wealth of confusion, Bopara was half-way down but then they both turn around and head back to where they came from, Morgan ends up diving back into his ground and the direct hit isn't quite in time

back of a length, Morgan tries to help it around the corner but gets a top edge and it carries all the way to deep backward sqaure. That's a very bad wicket for England to lose. Morgan got it slightly wrong and that was dangerous the way he tried to play it, had he tried to whack into Harborne it may well have gone for six
full on the stumps, tucked through square leg and they get a single
full on the stumps, tries to play to leg but just rolls it to short leg
similar delivery but a touch straighter and patted back up the wicket
touch straight and worked wide of midwicket for an easy run
forward just outside off and ran to backward point
fuller and driven firmly wide enough of mid-off for a single
tries to flick a slightly shorter ball around the corner but gets it off the pad to short leg
bumper first up, ducked, too high
full and wide of off stump, driven at and gets a bit of a top edge that almost was in reach of a diving Dilshan at backward point
tighter line and pushed carefully out to deep cover
yorker length, dug out on the bounce back to the bowler
another yorker, played back to the bowler again, nothing else really you can do with that
this is a quick inswinger yorker but Buttler is onto it and defends into the off side
very full again but gets the line slightly wrong and a hint of width outside off allows Buttler to ping it past extra-cover, great timing
full on the leg stump, rolled into forward square leg and there's an easy single
similar delivery but this is just flicked to midwicket
slightly more leg side and Buttler whips it with good timing backward of square, long chase for the deep fielder and he just gets the dive out in time
length delivery and dropped on the bounce to short leg
full length and turned through square leg
full length and punched down the ground to long-on
full outside leg, worked towards mid-on
low full toss but clipped straight to midwicket
leans into a full delivery outside off, pushes out to deep cover
digs out a slower-ball yorker, dribbles to the leg side and Bopara is alert to the single
defended to the off side
push-and-run towards mid-off so he'll keep the strike
full at the stumps, pushed to midwicket
flicked outside off stump, Bopara drives square through point
props forward, pushes gently into the off side
gets this very fine with a dinky sweep, Sangakkara actually skipped too far across and believes he has missed a catching chance. Given runs so technically he has, I suppse
pushed to the off side
worked down the ground
straight, tucked to the leg side
short delivery, rolls his wrist on a pull and long leg can't stop a second
on a length, defended back to the bowler
picks out midwicket this time
drops it into the off side but can't steal a single
on a length, softly defended to the bowler. Gentle cricket from England.
flicked through straight midwicket, all along the deck

another horror show for England! Bopara goes to pull a short ball, which he completely misses and gets bowled between his legs as the ball dips slightly under the shot. Credit to Mendis as well, though, as it was delivered slower
defended to the leg side
he oversteps, that's careless, worked off the pads behind square
big full toss, Buttler uses his feet but can only club it down to long-off
tucked into the leg side
very full, Jordan flicks it from under his eyes to deep square-leg
good length around off stump, prodded back towards Mathews
that's an awful delivery, short ball way down the leg side, dies before Sangakkara and bobbles through him towards fine leg
slower ball, outside off, left alone
nips into Jordan off a good length, defended to the on side
keeps it full, pushed to mid-off...England can't afford to cut loose until very near the end now
short again, not so poorly directed, but still called wide much to the chagrin of Sangakkara
width outside off but it doesn't cost anything as Jordan cuts to point
cut to point again
opens the face and runs it behind point
driven to deep cover
pushed to the leg side
drifts outside leg stump, flicked to deep square
slightly shorter, played to the leg side
driven towards mid-off who is deep enough for the single
looked out with a hit! Buttler was struggling. Jordan dropped an ran into the off side. Buttler dived but would have been short with a strike from Thirimanne
defended back to the bowler
slower ball outside off, dropped square towards point
can't beat backward point as he opens the face
some power there from Jordan, short delivery and he pulled it in front of square
back on a length outside off, pushed through point to the sweeper
turns into Jordan, picks out square leg
starts to use his feet, it's a very full delivery, pushed down the ground
shovelled down to long-on
outside off, he comes forward and drives to cover
held back a little, some slow turn, worked to midwicket
this one spins the other way, away from Jordan, and is another dot ball as it's pushed to cover
full on the stumps, slower delivery, pushed into the covers
another slower ball yorker, actually this one didn't pitch, he opens the face down to third man
short ball over leg stump, Buttler ducks
short again, over off stump this time, Buttler pulls this time out to deep square
top edge off another short delivery, 'watch for the spin' down at fine leg and Mendis gets beaten which concedes another run
full toss on the pads, flicked to fine leg...no spin for Mendis to worry about this time
full and squeezed to midwicket
drifts onto the pads, clipped away fine and this pair are very rapid between the wickets
defended to the off side...boos ring around the ground
worked into the leg side
flicked from outside to square leg
full and driven to cover. A dramatic over.
flicked to mid-on
big appeal for lbw, was full at leg stump but perhaps swinging to miss leg
low full toss, driven to mid-off
on leg stump, deflects behind square on the leg side
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square
cleaned up! Full and straight, Tredwell misses trying to drive through the off side
short outside leg stump, pulled away backward of square and the fielder can't stop it even with a dive
flicked to the leg side
nudged into midwicket
left alone
turns quite sharply, runs off the open face to short third man
full and flicked in the air into midwicket
short ball, Jordan ducks, it's called a wide
full outside off, lovely drive from Jordan as he slots it between cover and mid-off
full and dug out to midwicket
banged in short, pulled to deep square leg
yorker dug out into the off side
worked into midwicket
can't beat midwicket as he flicks off his toes
driven into the off side
nine down! A awful mix-up. Jordan nudged to the leg side. Not sure there was ever a single but Anderson kept on running and Jordan had no chance in the end
brings out the reverse sweep, an appeal for lbw but it's given as a run as it dribbles to short fine leg...not sure there was much, if any, bat
props forward and defends
beats the outside, Gurney didn't really have a clue there
all over! A slower ball completely defeats Anderson as he hoicks to leg. Hits the off stump.

inn2.comm: full and swinging gently away from off stump, Dilshan leans out and gets a thick edge to third man to get the chase underway
full length pushed across Perera who leaves alone
similar delivery and similarly left
fuller but still wide enough to leave
tighter line and a firm drive but straight to cover, that was whacked hard
good leave this, it started from a decent off stump line and moved away, well left
pushed miles wide of off stump and Buttler has to dive a long way to his right to take it, almost a Morkel
not quite as wide but still wide enough for the umpire, Dilshan swung and missed and nearly edged that
gets the line right now, it swung away as Dilshan left it
tight line, dropped down towards square leg and they steal a quite single
back of a length, blocked in the crease around off stump
little too straight and takes the thigh guard just behind square on the leg side for an another run
tight at the body again, it comes off the thigh pad again but this time runs to point
back of a length, tucked behind square leg and they jog a single
full just outside off, driven to the right of mid-off and they take a sharp single
length delivery, shapes onto the off stump, Perera defends in the crease
too straight and with long leg up and this is tucked for four
full on off stump and a delightfully timed punch through cover point, doesn't quite reach the rope which is a shame, that was remarkable timing
this strikes the pad playing to leg, brief cry for lbw but it's too high
another off side whack, went off like a greyhound out of the traps but straight to mid-off
little straight - a general consideration so far - pushed out to long leg
touch short and any width is greedily seized upon by Perera who cuts hard through cover point
forward and dropped into the covers for a sharp single
this isn't that short and Dilshan pulls well and gets it through square leg
forward and dropped into square leg, Perera sent back looking for a single and has to dive back into his ground, Bopara misses at the non-striker's end anyway
too short again and Dilshan pulls through square leg again, poor ball but well timed
back of a length, tucked down to long leg
miles down leg, Buttler dives and gets a fingertip to it and that saved four, long leg cuts it off
short, goes to pull, there a bit late and it comes off the toe to midwicket
poor line yet again, comes off the thigh pad down to the long leg rope
that's more like it from Anderson, full of length, nips away and beats Dilshan outside off, too little of that so far
and another beauty, this draws Dilshan forward and nips away to beat the outside edge, fantastic delivery
good length on a straighter line and blocked back to the bowler
but he starts with a wide, swinging down leg
full length just outside off, Perera tries to whack it back past mid-on and provides a caught and bowled chance to Jordan by his left knee but he couldn't hold on
full on middle and leg, clipped out to deep square
full on middle and leg, squirted out wide of long leg and they get back for a second
touch full and crucially a touch wide but allowed Dilshan to thrash his hands through it and he timed it well enough past point
same line and whacked again through the same region, very poor bowling
this slides into the pads and comes off the pad to long leg
length ball and slapped hard to mid-off
back of a length but too straight and tickled down to long leg
good length and blocked in front of off stump
touch straight and flicked down to long leg
bumper, swayed inside
good length on off stump, blocked in the crease
a step to leg and firm bash through cover, Tredwell was just a touch short

a skip down the wicket, slapped into the off side but in the air and Root dives to catch at cover a fine flying take to his right-hand side and England get a much-needed wicket. Dilshan didn't get the elevation on the stroke and it was an excellent catch from Root
back and pushing to cover point
back again but it was a little full for the stroke and Sangakkara is beaten outside off
floated up on the stumps and ran back to the bowler
full just outside off stump and ran down to long-off
good length on off stump, blocked in the crease
tight line but very well left as it shapes across the left-hander
this comes back at the left-hander but a little short and tucked from the crease to square leg
touch fuller inviting the drive, mistimed to short extra-cover
back of a length, tucked from the crease to midwicket
full just outside off, a miscued drive to mid-on
full and flicked towards mid-on, they decline to take the fielder on
forward and pressed into midwicket, it drops into a gap and they take a quick run
tossed right up just outside off and driven, just past short extra to long-on
a flashing sweep off a length to deep square-leg, bashed that but straight to the fielder
firm press from the crease to short extra

floated up, sharp turn squares Sangakkara up takes a thick edge that's taken by Jordan with an outstanding leap to his left, outstanding take because that went sharply off the edge but it was the sharp turn that did for Sangakkara, it pitched on about middle and leg and ragged right across the stumps
bumper that Perera just enough to keep down to square leg
full at the pads, cry for lbw but it pitched well outside leg
forward to firmly play into cover point
bumper, too big and wided
full length on the pads, clipped wide of long leg and they can take a second

full at the stumps, huge cry for lbw and given him out! Perera goes for the review almost immediately but there's nothing on Hot Spot nor on Real Time Snicko. Height could save Perera here but no, Hawk Eye has the delivery taking a good smack of the top of off stump, far more than "umpire's call" might suggest. Classic full inswing from Anderson and England are moving here
and this finds the outside edge but it runs wide of second slip to third man
floated up onto off stump, press forward into the covers
a little straighter, forward to block up the wicket
batsman hangs back this time and blocks in front of off stump
fuller and rolled to short extra
tries to open the face on this but no single past backward point
quicker ball nearly catches Thirimanne out but he blocks in front of all three
good length on off stump, blocked in the crease
touch shorter and blocked in front of off stump
bumper, Jayawardene quickly under it
full at the pads, clipped through square leg and they can get back for a second
good length on off stump and blocked, too short though, needs to be right up there
this is a better length but too wide to induce a stroke and that may be the end of Anderson's spell
around the wicket, tucked from off stump into point and they take a quick single
over to the right-hander, off stump and pushed up on the leg side
full length, easy drive out to long-on
forward on off stump, pushed to the bowler's right hand
a press outside off, ran through point and with the field back there's easy runs available
full just outside off stump, Jayawardene forward and defends
full at the off stump, a firm drive and finds extra-cover where Bell dives and saves very well diving to his left
tighter line and just blocked back to the bowler
good length at the off stump, blocked into the covers
length delivery on off stump, punched firmly to point
a cutter, 77mph, outside off stump, cut at and missed
tight off stump line pushed from the crease into the covers and Gurney is back with a maiden
forward just outside off to defend with the turn into midwicket
played across the line to square leg
wide outside off and cut but just a single to deep cover running to his left
full and driven to mid-off who's too deep to prevent the single
goes around the wicket, forward on the stumps and just blocked into the on side
forward and turned to square leg
full length on the off stump, blocked from the crease
bit of width to work with and this is guided to third man
full angled across the right-hander who hangs back and defends around off stump
a little straight and Jayawardene has the chance to tuck down to long leg
back and played firmly to extra cover
full and Thirimanne comes firmly forward and chips it just out of the reach of Gurney's right hand, moment of fortune for the batsman
flicked off his pads to square leg
gets nicely across the stumps and flicks to fine leg
nice bowling, beats the outside edge with out that turns and bounces. Lovely ball to the left hander
tight run! Pressed forward and pushed into the covers. Bopara swooped, it needed a direct hit but it's just wide and Root needs to collect which means Thirimanne can dive in
forward and blocked
worked out to deep square
that's a cracker, pushed across Jayawardene and just nips enough off the seam to beat the outside edge as he came forward although did feel for the ball
a little fuller, on off stump, defended to cover
short of a length, Jayawardene onto his toes and gets behind the line to tuck it backward of square
a touch too straight and that allows him to tuck this out to deep midwicket

missed chance! Potentially a huge moment. Nice delivery finds the edge, this time Jayawardene feeling away from his body, but neither Buttler or Jordan go for the catch. The chance went right down the middle of the gap between them
pulls his bat inside the line
round the wicket, defended to cover
comes forward, pushes with hard hands and the ball loops in the air for a while towards backward point
solidly defended this time, out to cover
ooh, goes back to quick a full ball, plays a little around it but defends safely enough in the end
stretches forward with bat and pad together, a muted appeal for lbw
defended back to the bowler...Tredwell returns with a maiden, but Sri Lanka know the key will be to see out him and Anderson
defended to the off side
full outside off, left alone
left alone again, this one doesn't carry to Buttler
makes him play this time, calmly defended to cover
dragged down short, Jayawardene pulls in the air but with no great power so deep square was never in the action except to pick the ball up
a controlled edge down to third man as he opens the face
floated up on middle, Thirimanne well forward and defends
that breaks the shackles, he's had enough of prodding around, down on one knee and slog-sweeps him over deep midwicket
shorter delivery, he goes back and drives to backward point
angled into leg stump, tucked to deep square-leg
worked from outside off towards midwicket, for a moment they think of single but stay where they are
finds midwicket again, Morgan doesn't field cleanly but Bopara tidies up
poor start, down the leg side, extra run and extra delivery
gets outside off, driven on the up to deep cover
that's a decent delivery, nips back off a good length, defended to midwicket
full outside off, Jayawardene walks into his defensive push which finds mid-on
gets across outside off to defend
gets a little too straight, flicked to deep square
on off stump, defended to point
gets forward outside off and defends
neat stroke, gets down early and paddles this through short fine-leg
left alone outside off
big stride into the ball, defends to short cover
this one grips, draws Thirimanne away from his body but it's played along the ground to point
fuller delivery, played to cover
short of a length, shoved down the leg side...another wide, too many from England in this series
nice drive, leans into the full delivery and places it wide of deep cover
tucked off the body down to fine leg
fuller on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
leg side(ish) again but the clip picks out midwicket
drives square through point to the sweeper
full outside off, defended firmly back to the bowler
full outside off, driven to deep cover...three figures for Sri Lanka
nicely played, waits for this outside off them opens the face towards short third man
too short, driven square off the back foot to deep cover
fired in at leg stump, driven down to long-off
taken from outside off and worked down to long-on
pushed out to the cover sweeper
round the wicket, very full, dug out to midwicket
drives out to deep cover
drags the length back, defended with an open face to backward point
back to a yorker, blocked to the off side
beaten, this one straighten off the seam, Jayawardene trying to work it through the vacant slip area
good boot from Ravi...a punchy drive from Jayawardene but Bopara stuck out his left foot to stop it
defended to cover
almost a run out! Pushed into the off side, Jayawardene comes down for the single and is then sent back. He slips a bit as he turns, gets out the dive. Would have been back with a hit
into the off side
punched down the ground
driven to long-on
a little shorter but Thirimanne picks out point
driven firmly back to the bowler
slower ball, worked into the leg side
very full, another slower one I think, dug out to the off side
good length, on off stump, defended
yorker, jabbed out
angled down to third man as Bopara hustles through an over
too short, gives him the chance to drive to deep cover off the back foot
poor delivery, dragged down short, Jayawardene pulls firmly out to deep midwicket
worked to deep square
pushed to point where there's a good diving save
neatly driven down the ground
picks up another easy single...Sri Lanka looking in control
full, hint of swing into Jayawardene, driven to mid-off
delicate touch from Mahela, it's short of a length and he just waits for it before opening the face to third man
round the wicket, pushes towards mid-on and sets off straight away. Jordan can't stop them.
worked off the stumps to deep square
flicked off the pads to deep square
onto the front foot, drives comfortably out to the cover sweeper
nice start, tossed up outside off, it turns back into Jayawardene and takes the pad
good response, paddles this from well outside off through short fine-leg
gets outside off and defends
small stride forward and blocks
taken from outside off and worked to long-on
too straight, clipped off leg stump to deep square...Tredwell annoyed with himself
round the wicket, short of a length, opens the face to third man
poor delivery, too short, sits up nicely for Jayawardene who pulls it between deep square and long leg...in the air for a while, but very safe
back on a full length, defended to mid-on
short of a length, flips it off his hip to long leg
just short! This time a shorter delivery nearly works, helped around the corner by Thirimanne, comes off the top edge, but doesn't quite reach Gurney at fine leg as he runs in
oh, that's brilliant by Jayawardene...glances this almost out of Buttler's gloves very fine to third man
defended to cover
driven off the back foot to deep cover
very gentle piece of cricket, just nudged from outside off to long-on
too straight, worked into the leg side, Buttler chases it himself and stops them going for a second
very full, the bat face closes as he fetches it to the leg side
prods forward, almost early on the shot but just holds himself back long enough
full outside off, defended
gets across outside off, bat and pad together in defence
keeping it fall, Jayawardene a little caught in the crease this time, pushed down the pitch to Anderson
shorter in length, defended
angled into the pads, worked to deep square
full outside off, nice delivery, starts to shape back, but it's only a dot as Thirimanne shoulders arms
he's a little late in defence here, the ball nearly rolls back towards the stumps
full on middle and off, defended
all defence, on off stump, played to mid-off
behind the line, defended
on leg stump, tucked down to long leg
excellent shot, short of a length outside off, driven behind square wide of third man but Bopara gets around with a slide
full just outside off, pleasantly driven to cover
forward press just outside off and finds extra cover
short and hooked down to long leg
glorious drive, a little overpitched and Thirimanne leans into it and times it wonderfully through cover
drops the length back a little, tight off stump line, angled down to third man
lenght ball slides down leg
a foot outside off, steered down to third man
full just outside off stump, played forward to and pushed to cover point
angled off the back foot to cover point again
around the wicket now, full just outside off, pushed up to cover point yet agin
full just outside off and dabbed to, whatdoyaknow, cover point
back over the wicket and this time nudges it past cover point to the sweeper and it brings up fifty, a first in the series for Jayawardene, his side have needed him tonight
full on off stump, rolled to extra cover
length delivery just outside off, cleverly steered wide of third man for a couple
touch shorter, the same stroke played but straight to third man this time
short and pulled to deep square

full length and Jayawardene goes to drive down the ground and gets it all wrong, putting it high into the sky and straight to mid-off. Extraordinary stroke, he was in complete control put didn't time this at all, sending it high and Anderson didn't have to move to take a straightforward catch. Perhaps didn't quite come onto the bat as Jayawardene would have liked
bumper that drifts down leg
short again, this time on target and Mathews gets up on his toes to knock it down on the off side
full just outside off and Mathews leans into it and plays through cover for just a single, it was decent fielding
floated up just outside off, knocked down to long-on
around the wicket, floated onto the stumps, blocked on the front foot
back and tapped down to long-off
back over, forward and tucked back to the bowler
slightly tighter line and clipped to short midwicket
back and pushing to long-off
short and hooked out to deep square
good length on off stump, knocked towards point
back on the stumps, knocked through midwicket and they run hard far two
bumper and it gets way over head height
good length, Mathews dabbing from the crease and gets an edge down to third man
full outside off and Thirimanne lazily leans across for it without moving his feet and plays and misses
back foot steer down to third man
around the stumps, full, pushed to extra cover
lovely floated up delivery that spins away and beats the bat attempting to drive
slip goes back in but this is a little short, tucked into the covers
forward right on top of the delivery and clipped through square leg
back and clipped to short third man where Jordan misfields, bad time for that, and they slip away for two
back and pushed down to long-on
full at the stumps, flicked straight to midwicket
full at the off stump, driven off low on the bat back to the bowler
little width outside off and clipped to deep cover
powerfully struck off the back foot square on the off side, they get a sharp two wide of third man
forward, pushed up to mid-on and they take a sharp single and get home comfortably
back of a length on off stump, blocked up the wicket
full length at the off stump, forward and dabs it down to third man and with just one four and one six Thirimanne goes to a very useful half-century, battled well
around the wicket onto off stump, just blocked
an off cutter, fuller length, same line, just blocked once more
touch straighter and tucked wide of midwicket for a single
back over the wicket, Thirimanne lets it come to him again and opens the face to turn it to third man
full length driven straight to extra-cover
again, Thirimanne is angling down to third man for an easy single

full length outside off, Mathews runs down to it and gets a wild outside edge trying to drive, it whirls down to third man and Gurney again running in can't get there, and it skips under his dive on goes for four
short and pulled down to long leg but a superb piece of sliding work from Ballance keeps them down to just a single
Thirimanne yet again just sitting tight and taking a single to third man
full just outside off, a flashing drive wide enough of deep cover so them to scramble back for the second
full right at the stumps, clipped out to square leg
around the wicket, low full toss, clipped out to deep midwicket but just a single
whatdoyaknow, Thirimanne sits in the crease and uses the pace to take a single to third man
down the track and goes for the big shot again and this time nails it over mid-on, clubbed for a one bounce four, just what the tourists needed
full on off stump, played forward back to the bowler
a step to leg and cracked over cover, powerfully struck and the power of Mathews evident again
over the wicket, full length, driven back on the bounce to the bowler
back of a length, slower ball, and Thirimanne back quickly, picks the delivery, and lifts it over midwicket, a controlled stroke and it's well timed enough to go for four
length ball just blocked in the crease
full on the off stump, pushed up back to the bowler
cracking drive with Anderson offering width but Root makes a handy save at cover point
full on the stumps, driven in the air back to the bowler and dropped he got a solid right hand to it at shoulder height but couldn't cling on, tough chance but England needed that
excellent yorker, dug out back to the bowler
short of a length, tucked around the corner for a single to long leg
yorker just outside off but again Thirimanne manages to dig it out down to third man
step to leg, Jordan follows him, Mathews able to angle it down to third man
down the wicket this time but again Thirimanne manages to find third man, this time reaching for a drive and opening the face
short and slapped hard down to third man but it's wide of the fielder for a once-bounce four, once again, Mathews get the run of the ball with that just evading the fielder
firm drive to just wide of mid-off for a sharp single
absolute dirt from Bopara, back of a length sliding on the leg side and it's easily turned around the corner backward of square
now this is short outside off and slapped past short third man
